intro: Hieracium insuccatum var. occidentale, commonly known as the western hedgehog. It is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae, characterized by its spiny, hairy stems and yellow to orange composite flowers. Native to western North America, it thrives in dry, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and open woodlands. The plant has alternate, lance-shaped leaves with rough textures, and its inflorescence consists of numerous small florets arranged in a disk. It is often found in regions with temperate climates and is adapted to poor soil conditions.
